title: 7 Bollywood Ladies On How To Be The Best Bohemian Version Of Yourself
text:
facebook 
Yes, bohemian is more a way of life than a seasonal trend. But since Coachella broke onto the mainstream scene as the only legit music festival, and also birthed the festival-girl as its global mascot, it has become a recurring wardrobe theme. Right at the onset of spring, Kendell Jenner and her squad begin appearing in all things floral, presenting themselves as the ideal mood-board for our yearly stint as the flower girl. Well, we suggest that you swap your 70s idols with our homegirls. Our leading ladies have us convinced with their recent outfit choices. If bohemian is predominately your spring statement, take a look at how these seven ladies have aced it. 1.Practical bohemian is what Deepika Padukone endorses, with her diaphanous roomy Chloe top paired with jeans, looking all kinds of appropriate for the unforgiving summer ahead. Instagram/via deepika.padukone.fanpage 2.Neha Dhupia picks an asymmetrical Chola dress for her bohemian statement. What’s cool is that she even sports hipster-verified braided hairdo with it. Instagram/via afashionistadiaries 3.Sonam Kapoor’s folksy Payal Pratap dress secures top spot in our wishlist, with its languid-yet-feminine fit. Instagram/via afashionistadiaries 4.In case you were wondering how to transition bohemian into your evening wear, let Shruti Haasan’s separates – featuring a crop top, draped skirt and a long jacket – give you a quick master class. A post shared by House Of Masaba (@houseofmasaba) on Mar 21, 2017 at 2:06am PDT 
5.Sridevi’s languid AQ/AQ jumpsuit, together with a rich-girl scarf, is your cue to doing luxe bohemian, probably on one of your exotic travels. Instagram/via afashionistadiaries 6. Anushka Sharma’s wrap dress by pero is an easy winner, not only for being superiorly comfy but also for getting that plaid-floral pattern just right. Instagram/alliaalrufai 7.Kriti Sanon brings out her hipster pants for a night-out by pairing it with a high-collared top, and making a convincing case for glam-boho. Instagram/via
